judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION
OFFCIAL ASSIGNEE'S REPORT DT.18TH NOVEMBER, 2006
IN
PETITION NO.8 OF 1975 
Re: Jyoti P. Gurudasani
..Insolvent.
Ex-parte:
M/s. Rayex (India) Limited
..Petitioning Creditor.
...
Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present.
CORAM: DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD, J.
 21st November, 2006.
P.C. :
An order of adjudication was passed on 15th July, 1975.
The schedule of assets and liabilities filed by the Insolvent on 19th
December, 1975 shows three unsecured creditors to the tune of
Rs.9,436.93, one partly secured creditor to the tune of Rs.1,000/-
and property of the insolvent of Rs.96.29. On 15th September,
the insolvency was annulled under Rule 136 of the Bombay
Insolvency Rules, 1910 subject to realisation of the property of the
insolvent. At present only Rs.191.57 is lying to the credit of the
estate account. In the present case, no further recoveries are
possible. The Official Assignee has prayed that this amount may
be transferred to the unclaimed dividend capital account under
Rule 178 of the Bombay Insolvency Rules, 1910 and thereafter to
the unclaimed dividend capital revenue account and the account
may be closed for administrative purposes. Having regard to the
circumstances set out in the report of the Official Assignee, there is
no reason why the prayer should not be granted. Prayer clause (a)
of the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly granted.
